mahindra_launches.text: [{'url': 'https://cargraze.com/blog/upcoming-mahindra-cars-in-2025-electric-suvs-luxury-coupes-and-more', 'content': "Upcoming Mahindra Cars in 2025: Electric SUVs, Luxury Coupes, and More  | Cargraze Home Cars Car Blog Tools Loan EMI Calculator Mileage Calculator Sell Used Car Check RC Login/ Register Home Car News Upcoming Mahindra Cars in 2025: Electric SUVs, Luxury Coupes, and More Upcoming Mahindra Cars in 2025: Electric SUVs, Luxury Coupes, and More Published On Dec 25, 2024 By Cargraze for Car News Mahindra's Exciting Line-Up of Cars Expected to Launch in 2025 Mahindra, a name synonymous with rugged SUVs and innovative engineering in India, is gearing up for an exciting year ahead. The Indian automaker has several highly anticipated launches lined up for 2025, promising to cater to diverse customer preferences. Heres a sneak peek at whats in store. 1. Mahindra XUV900 - The Luxury Coupe SUV The Mahindra XUV900 is poised to be a game-changer in the SUV segment. With its coupe-like design, the XUV900 will redefine luxury and performance. Engine Options: 2.0L mStallion turbo-petrol (200 BHP). 2.2L mHawk diesel (185 BHP). Specifications: 8-speed automatic transmission. All-wheel drive (AWD) option. Features: Panoramic sunroof. Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS). 12-inch infotainment system with wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay. Safety: 6 airbags. Electronic Stability Program (ESP). 5-star Global NCAP rating (expected). Mileage: Petrol: 14 km/l. Diesel: 18 km/l. Expected Price: 25-30 lakh. Launch Date: Mid-2025. 2. Mahindra Thar 5-Door - A Practical Off-Roader The iconic Mahindra Thar is set to become even more versatile with the introduction of a 5-door variant, catering to families who crave adventure. Engine Options: 2.0L turbo-petrol (150 BHP). 2.2L diesel (130 BHP). Specifications: Manual and automatic transmission options. Enhanced ground clearance and approach angles. Features: Removable hardtop. 10-inch touchscreen infotainment system. Cruise control. Safety: Dual airbags. Roll-over mitigation. Hill descent control. Mileage: Petrol: 13 km/l. Diesel: 16 km/l. Expected Price: 14-18 lakh. Launch Date: Early 2025. 3. Mahindra BE.05 - The Electric Marvel Mahindras push into the EV space is highlighted by the futuristic BE.05, part of the Born Electric range. This compact SUV will focus on sustainability without compromising on style and performance. Engine Options: Electric Motor (200-300 km range per charge). Specifications: 60 kWh battery pack. Fast-charging capability (0-80% in 40 minutes). Features: Over-the-air (OTA) updates. Digital cockpit with dual screens. Vegan leather upholstery. Safety: 5-star NCAP certification (expected). Lane Keep Assist and Adaptive Cruise Control. Mileage: 6 km/kWh (estimated). Expected Price: 20-25 lakh. Launch Date: Late 2025. 4. Mahindra Scorpio N EV - An Electric Icon in the Making The Mahindra Scorpio N EV will bring the robust Scorpio lineage into the electric era. Expect unmatched power and reliability with eco-friendly credentials. Engine Options: Electric Motor (450 Nm torque). Specifications: 70 kWh battery pack. 4WD capability. Features: 360-degree camera. Wireless charging pad. Premium audio system. Safety: Advanced collision detection. Side and curtain airbags. Mileage: 5.5 km/kWh (estimated). Expected Price: 35-40 lakh. Launch Date: Mid-to-late 2025. Conclusion Mahindras 2025 lineup reflects its commitment to innovation, sustainability, and customer-centric design. Whether youre eyeing a luxurious coupe SUV, a practical off-roader, or a cutting-edge EV, theres something for everyone. With competitive pricing and advanced features, Mahindra is set to strengthen its position in the Indian automotive market. Stay tuned as these models hit the roads and redefine driving experiences! Specs, Top Features, Performance, and Discounts Revealed CarGraze Jan 01, 2025 Mahindra BE6 and XUV.e9 Compared: Specifications, Tech Features, Price, and Performance CarGraze Dec 31, 2024 Vinfast VF3 Micro", 'images': [{'url': 'https://cargraze.com/assets/img/otp-login-register.webp', 'alt_text': 'verify login account', 'confidence': 0.7}], 'rank': 1}, {'url': 'https://carsandtrucks.in/upcoming-mahindra-cars-to-watch-out-for-in-2025/', 'content': 'New Launch Mahindra Cars in 2025 Launches and Updates | carsandtrucks.in New Cars New Trucks Car Loan Blog Contact Homepage Blog Upcoming Mahindra Cars to Watch Out for in 2025 Upcoming Mahindra Cars to Watch Out for in 2025 carsandtrucks.in 26 December 2024 Car News Mahindra has been at the forefront of innovation, grabbing attention in 2024 with models like the Thar Roxx and the electric XEV 9e and BE 6 SUVs. The automaker is set to keep this momentum in 2025 by unveiling new models in its XEV and BE electric lineup while upgrading its popular ICE-powered vehicles. Heres a comprehensive look at Mahindras exciting launches and updates slated for 2025. 1. XUV 4XO EV / XEV 4e Expected Launch: March 2025 Expected Price: 16 lakh The all-electric version of the XUV 3XO, potentially named XUV 4XO EV or XEV 4e, was recently spotted testing. Likely to feature 34.5 kWh and 39.5 kWh battery options similar to the XUV400 EV, this model will offer a futuristic design and advanced features. Expect it to launch with a slightly higher price than its predecessor, priced between 16.74 lakh and 17.69 lakh (ex-showroom). 2. XEV 7e Expected Launch: March 2025 Expected Price: 21 lakh The production-ready XEV 7e, a fully electric version of the XUV700, is expected to rival premium EVs with features like a triple-screen layout, multi-zone climate control, and ADAS. Equipped with 59 kWh and 79 kWh battery options, it could offer a range of up to 650 km. 3. Thar 3-door Facelift Expected Launch: April 2025 Expected Price: 12 lakh Following the successful launch of the 5-door Thar Roxx, Mahindra is set to refresh the 3-door variant. This facelift is expected to feature updated styling with a 6-slat grille, C-shaped LED DRLs, and dual-tone alloys, along with an upgraded cabin. Engine options will likely include 1.5L diesel, 2.2L diesel, and 2.0L turbo-petrol options. 4. Mahindra BE 07 Expected Launch: August 15, 2025 Expected Price: 30 lakh Mahindra initially named the electric SUV BE 6E and later due to issues with Indigo airlines they had to rename it as BE 6E. While we know the official starting price of the Mahindra BE 6 electric SUV. We have no information about the higher variants and pricing. Mahindra will be revealing the variants and pricing of this electric SUV in January during the Bharat Mobility Expo. 5. Thar Roxx Petrol 44 Launch: To be Announced Mahindra as we know launched the Roxx in the market earlier this year and deliveries for the same have also started. Mahindra is only offering 44 as an option with some of the variants. The 44 is currently available with diesel engine option only. However, there is a possibility that Mahindra might introduce a smaller 1.5 liter diesel engine and a petrol 44 variant might get introduced later next year. With a mix of cutting-edge EVs and exciting updates to existing models, Mahindra aims to dominate the automotive scene in 2025. Whether youre looking for innovative electric SUVs or refreshed classics, theres something for everyone. Share Tweet Add a comment Cancel reply Your email address will not be published. final_report.summary: Mahindra is launching or updating several models in 2025, including electric SUVs (BE series, Scorpio N EV, XUV400 EV), refreshed ICE vehicles (Thar facelift, XUV700 facelift), and new variants (Thar 5-door). Key features span performance, safety, technology, and comfort, varying across models.
final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: Mahindra is set to introduce a range of new and updated vehicles in 2025, focusing on both electric and internal combustion engine (ICE) models. The information gathered suggests a strong emphasis on electric SUVs, with the BE series taking center stage. Alongside these, existing models are being refreshed with facelifts and new variants to maintain competitiveness in the market. The following is a detailed breakdown of features categorized by vehicle model:

**1. Mahindra BE.05**

The Mahindra BE.05 is an all-electric compact SUV positioned within Mahindra's 'Born Electric' range. It emphasizes sustainability while delivering a modern design and performance. Key features are as follows:

*   **Performance:**
    *   Electric Motor (200-300 km range per charge).
    *   60 kWh battery pack.
    *   Fast-charging capability (0-80% in 40 minutes).
*   **Technology:**
    *   Over-the-air (OTA) updates.
    *   Digital cockpit with dual screens.
*   **Comfort:**
    *   Vegan leather upholstery.
*   **Safety:**
    *   Expected 5-star NCAP certification.
    *   Lane Keep Assist and Adaptive Cruise Control.

**2. Mahindra XUV900**

The Mahindra XUV900 is a luxury coupe SUV designed to redefine luxury and performance in the SUV segment. It incorporates a coupe-like design with advanced features.

*   **Performance:**
    *   2.0L mStallion turbo-petrol (200 BHP).
    *   2.2L mHawk diesel (185 BHP).
    *   8-speed automatic transmission.
    *   All-wheel drive (AWD) option.
*   **Technology:**
    *   Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS).
    *   12-inch infotainment system with wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay.
*   **Comfort:**
    *   Panoramic sunroof.
*   **Safety:**
    *   6 airbags.
    *   Electronic Stability Program (ESP).
    *   Expected 5-star Global NCAP rating.

**3. Mahindra Thar 5-Door**

The Mahindra Thar 5-Door is a versatile variant of the iconic off-roader, catering to families seeking adventure. It offers practicality without compromising on its rugged appeal.

*   **Performance:**
    *   2.0L turbo-petrol (150 BHP).
    *   2.2L diesel (130 BHP).
    *   Manual and automatic transmission options.
    *   Enhanced ground clearance and approach angles.
*   **Technology:**
    *   10-inch touchscreen infotainment system.
    *   Cruise control.
*   **Comfort:**
    *   Removable hardtop.
*   **Safety:**
    *   Dual airbags.
    *   Roll-over mitigation.
    *   Hill descent control.

**4. Mahindra Scorpio N EV**

The Mahindra Scorpio N EV brings the Scorpio lineage into the electric era. It focuses on power and reliability with eco-friendly credentials.

*   **Performance:**
    *   Electric Motor (450 Nm torque).
    *   70 kWh battery pack.
    *   4WD capability.
*   **Technology:**
    *   360-degree camera.
    *   Wireless charging pad.
    *   Premium audio system.
*   **Safety:**
    *   Advanced collision detection.
    *   Side and curtain airbags.

**5. Mahindra XUV 4XO EV / XEV 4e**

The all-electric version of the XUV 3XO, possibly named XUV 4XO EV or XEV 4e, features futuristic design and advanced features.

*   **Performance:**
    *   Likely to feature 34.5 kWh and 39.5 kWh battery options.
*   **Technology:** Not Specifically Mentioned, Expect Modern Infotainment.
*   **Safety:** Not Specifically Mentioned, Expect Standard Safety Features.

**6. Mahindra XEV 7e**

The production-ready XEV 7e, a fully electric version of the XUV700, is expected to compete with premium EVs.

*   **Performance:**
    *   Equipped with 59 kWh and 79 kWh battery options.
    *   Potential range of up to 650 km.
*   **Technology:**
    *   Triple-screen layout.
    *   Multi-zone climate control.
    *   ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems).

**7. Mahindra Thar 3-door Facelift**

Following the launch of the 5-door variant, Mahindra is set to refresh the 3-door variant with updated styling and an upgraded cabin.

*   **Exterior:**
    *   Updated styling with a 6-slat grille.
    *   C-shaped LED DRLs.
    *   Dual-tone alloys.
*   **Engine Options:**
    *   1.5L diesel, 2.2L diesel, and 2.0L turbo-petrol options are likely.

**Key Features Common Across Models:**

*   **Connectivity:** Modern infotainment systems with smartphone integration (Android Auto and Apple CarPlay).
*   **Safety:** Airbags, ABS with EBD, and other standard safety features are expected.
*   **Comfort:** Features like automatic climate control, power windows, and comfortable seating are anticipated.

This information is based on available data and expectations for upcoming Mahindra vehicles. Actual features and specifications may vary upon official launch.
risks_or_warnings: Many of the listed features are based on expectations and preliminary information. Actual features may differ.
Launch dates are subject to change.
Pricing information is speculative and may not reflect the final market price.

Mahindra XUV900 - The Luxury Coupe SUV The Mahindra XUV900 is poised to be a game-changer in the SUV segment. With its coupe-like design, the XUV900 will redefine luxury and performance. Engine Options: 2.0L mStallion turbo-petrol (200 BHP). 2.2L mHawk diesel (185 BHP). Specifications: 8-speed automatic transmission. All-wheel drive (AWD) option. Features: Panoramic sunroof. Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS). 12-inch infotainment system with wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay. Safety: 6 airbags. Electronic Stability Program (ESP). 5-star Global NCAP rating (expected). Mileage: Petrol: 14 km/l. Diesel: 18 km/l. Expected Price: 25-30 lakh. Launch Date: Mid-2025. 2. Mahindra Thar 5-Door - A Practical Off-Roader The iconic Mahindra Thar is set to become even more versatile with the introduction of a 5-door variant, catering to families who crave adventure. Engine Options: 2.0L turbo-petrol (150 BHP). 2.2L diesel (130 BHP). Specifications: Manual and automatic transmission options. Enhanced ground clearance and approach angles. Features: Removable hardtop. 10-inch touchscreen infotainment system. Cruise control. Safety: Dual airbags. Roll-over mitigation. Hill descent control. Mileage: Petrol: 13 km/l. Diesel: 16 km/l. Expected Price: 14-18 lakh. Launch Date: Early 2025. 3. Mahindra BE.05 - The Electric Marvel Mahindras push into the EV space is highlighted by the futuristic BE.05, part of the Born Electric range. This compact SUV will focus on sustainability without compromising on style and performance. Engine Options: Electric Motor (200-300 km range per charge). Specifications: 60 kWh battery pack. Fast-charging capability (0-80% in 40 minutes). Features: Over-the-air (OTA) updates. Digital cockpit with dual screens. Vegan leather upholstery. Safety: 5-star NCAP certification (expected). Lane Keep Assist and Adaptive Cruise Control. Mileage: 6 km/kWh (estimated). Expected Price: 20-25 lakh. Launch Date: Late 2025. 4. Mahindra Scorpio N EV - An Electric Icon in the Making The Mahindra Scorpio N EV will bring the robust Scorpio lineage into the electric era. Expect unmatched power and reliability with eco-friendly credentials. Engine Options: Electric Motor (450 Nm torque). Specifications: 70 kWh battery pack. 4WD capability. Features: 360-degree camera. Wireless charging pad. Premium audio system. Safety: Advanced collision detection. Side and curtain airbags. Mileage: 5.5 km/kWh (estimated). Expected Price: 35-40 lakh. Launch Date: Mid-to-late 2025. Conclusion Mahindras 2025 lineup reflects its commitment to innovation, sustainability, and customer-centric design. Whether youre eyeing a luxurious coupe SUV, a practical off-roader, or a cutting-edge EV, theres something for everyone. With competitive pricing and advanced features, Mahindra is set to strengthen its position in the Indian automotive market. Stay tuned as these models hit the roads and redefine driving experiences! The automaker is set to keep this momentum in 2025 by unveiling new models in its XEV and BE electric lineup while upgrading its popular ICE-powered vehicles. Heres a comprehensive look at Mahindras exciting launches and updates slated for 2025. 1. XUV 4XO EV / XEV 4e Expected Launch: March 2025 Expected Price: 16 lakh The all-electric version of the XUV 3XO, potentially named XUV 4XO EV or XEV 4e, was recently spotted testing. Likely to feature 34.5 kWh and 39.5 kWh battery options similar to the XUV400 EV, this model will offer a futuristic design and advanced features. Expect it to launch with a slightly higher price than its predecessor, priced between 16.74 lakh and 17.69 lakh (ex-showroom). 2. XEV 7e Expected Launch: March 2025 Expected Price: 21 lakh The production-ready XEV 7e, a fully electric version of the XUV700, is expected to rival premium EVs with features like a triple-screen layout, multi-zone climate control, and ADAS. Equipped with 59 kWh and 79 kWh battery options, it could offer a range of up to 650 km. 3. Thar 3-door Facelift Expected Launch: April 2025 Expected Price: 12 lakh Following the successful launch of the 5-door Thar Roxx, Mahindra is set to refresh the 3-door variant. This facelift is expected to feature updated styling with a 6-slat grille, C-shaped LED DRLs, and dual-tone alloys, along with an upgraded cabin. Engine options will likely include 1.5L diesel, 2.2L diesel, and 2.0L turbo-petrol options. 4. Mahindra BE 07 Expected Launch: August 15, 2025 Expected Price: 30 lakh Mahindra initially named the electric SUV BE 6E and later due to issues with Indigo airlines they had to rename it as BE 6E. While we know the official starting price of the Mahindra BE 6 electric SUV. We have no information about the higher variants and pricing. Mahindra will be revealing the variants and pricing of this electric SUV in January during the Bharat Mobility Expo. 5. Thar Roxx Petrol 44 Launch: To be Announced Mahindra as we know launched the Roxx in the market earlier this year and deliveries for the same have also started. Mahindra is only offering 44 as an option with some of the variants. The 44 is currently available with diesel engine option only. However, there is a possibility that Mahindra might introduce a smaller 1.5 liter diesel engine and a petrol 44 variant might get introduced later next year. With a mix of cutting-edge EVs and exciting updates to existing models, Mahindra aims to dominate the automotive scene in 2025. final_report.summary: Mahindra is launching or updating several models in 2025, including electric SUVs (BE series, Scorpio N EV, XUV400 EV), refreshed ICE vehicles (Thar facelift, XUV700 facelift), and new variants (Thar 5-door). Key features span performance, safety, technology, and comfort, varying across models.
final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: Mahindra is set to introduce a range of new and updated vehicles in 2025, focusing on both electric and internal combustion engine (ICE) models. The information gathered suggests a strong emphasis on electric SUVs, with the BE series taking center stage. Alongside these, existing models are being refreshed with facelifts and new variants to maintain competitiveness in the market. The following is a detailed breakdown of features categorized by vehicle model:

**1. Mahindra BE.05**

The Mahindra BE.05 is an all-electric compact SUV positioned within Mahindra's 'Born Electric' range. It emphasizes sustainability while delivering a modern design and performance. Key features are as follows:

*   **Performance:**
    *   Electric Motor (200-300 km range per charge).
    *   60 kWh battery pack.
    *   Fast-charging capability (0-80% in 40 minutes).
*   **Technology:**
    *   Over-the-air (OTA) updates.
    *   Digital cockpit with dual screens.
*   **Comfort:**
    *   Vegan leather upholstery.
*   **Safety:**
    *   Expected 5-star NCAP certification.
    *   Lane Keep Assist and Adaptive Cruise Control.

**2. Mahindra XUV900**

The Mahindra XUV900 is a luxury coupe SUV designed to redefine luxury and performance in the SUV segment. It incorporates a coupe-like design with advanced features.

*   **Performance:**
    *   2.0L mStallion turbo-petrol (200 BHP).
    *   2.2L mHawk diesel (185 BHP).
    *   8-speed automatic transmission.
    *   All-wheel drive (AWD) option.
*   **Technology:**
    *   Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS).
    *   12-inch infotainment system with wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay.
*   **Comfort:**
    *   Panoramic sunroof.
*   **Safety:**
    *   6 airbags.
    *   Electronic Stability Program (ESP).
    *   Expected 5-star Global NCAP rating.

**3. Mahindra Thar 5-Door**

The Mahindra Thar 5-Door is a versatile variant of the iconic off-roader, catering to families seeking adventure. It offers practicality without compromising on its rugged appeal.

*   **Performance:**
    *   2.0L turbo-petrol (150 BHP).
    *   2.2L diesel (130 BHP).
    *   Manual and automatic transmission options.
    *   Enhanced ground clearance and approach angles.
*   **Technology:**
    *   10-inch touchscreen infotainment system.
    *   Cruise control.
*   **Comfort:**
    *   Removable hardtop.
*   **Safety:**
    *   Dual airbags.
    *   Roll-over mitigation.
    *   Hill descent control.

**4. Mahindra Scorpio N EV**

The Mahindra Scorpio N EV brings the Scorpio lineage into the electric era. It focuses on power and reliability with eco-friendly credentials.

*   **Performance:**
    *   Electric Motor (450 Nm torque).
    *   70 kWh battery pack.
    *   4WD capability.
*   **Technology:**
    *   360-degree camera.
    *   Wireless charging pad.
    *   Premium audio system.
*   **Safety:**
    *   Advanced collision detection.
    *   Side and curtain airbags.

**5. Mahindra XUV 4XO EV / XEV 4e**

The all-electric version of the XUV 3XO, possibly named XUV 4XO EV or XEV 4e, features futuristic design and advanced features.

*   **Performance:**
    *   Likely to feature 34.5 kWh and 39.5 kWh battery options.
*   **Technology:** Not Specifically Mentioned, Expect Modern Infotainment.
*   **Safety:** Not Specifically Mentioned, Expect Standard Safety Features.

**6. Mahindra XEV 7e**

The production-ready XEV 7e, a fully electric version of the XUV700, is expected to compete with premium EVs.

*   **Performance:**
    *   Equipped with 59 kWh and 79 kWh battery options.
    *   Potential range of up to 650 km.
*   **Technology:**
    *   Triple-screen layout.
    *   Multi-zone climate control.
    *   ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems).

**7. Mahindra Thar 3-door Facelift**

Following the launch of the 5-door variant, Mahindra is set to refresh the 3-door variant with updated styling and an upgraded cabin.

*   **Exterior:**
    *   Updated styling with a 6-slat grille.
    *   C-shaped LED DRLs.
    *   Dual-tone alloys.
*   **Engine Options:**
    *   1.5L diesel, 2.2L diesel, and 2.0L turbo-petrol options are likely.

**Key Features Common Across Models:**

*   **Connectivity:** Modern infotainment systems with smartphone integration (Android Auto and Apple CarPlay).
*   **Safety:** Airbags, ABS with EBD, and other standard safety features are expected.
*   **Comfort:** Features like automatic climate control, power windows, and comfortable seating are anticipated.

This information is based on available data and expectations for upcoming Mahindra vehicles. Actual features and specifications may vary upon official launch.
risks_or_warnings: Many of the listed features are based on expectations and preliminary information. Actual features may differ.
Launch dates are subject to change.
Pricing information is speculative and may not reflect the final market price.
